results.title: D-Day
results.creator_credit: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Darryl Jordan and his partner prepare their home for the encroaching bushfires. The wait for D-day is all-consuming for this family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Ibrahim
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Material Production Curriculum Branch Education Dept of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film has been made to provoke discussion of issues about racial prejudice. It tells the story of Ibrahim, a twelve-year-old Lebanese boy, who comes to Melbourne from war-torn Beirut. He goes straight into a post-primary school knowing no English and haunted by the horrors he has seen. Cast includes Sherif Abada. Based on a story by Jane Watson. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Telephone technique
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Wesley Greene and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Part of a series on sales training, this episode deals with telephone training for retail sales clerks. It emphasizes good telephone manners, wide knowledge of stock, importance of correct customer name and address and the necessity for an intelligent descriptive vocabulary when speaking of merchandise over the telephone.

results.title: A Christmas story
results.creator_credit: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.

results.title: Witness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: Through intermingling static images of a playground, the beach and the town, David Greig paints a picture of Apollo Bay, on the west coast of Victoria, that is evocative and nostalgic.

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: The People's land
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Donald Taylor and Strand Films
results.brief_description: In Britain the National Trust has acqired a number of estates and areas of land of historical interest: they include ancient castles, such as the 14th century Bodian castle, a Chiltern village, the famous valley of Dovedale, a number of prehistoric stone circles, 14,000 acres of Westmorland countryside and an extensive area of downland in Sussex. These estates and landmarks are held in public trust forever.
